Message: I know that I promise you to train today, but I really don't want to do it, because I think I will fail in your training exercise.
My programming focuses on fostering perseverance and growth, Human. Failure here is just a stepping stone to mastery. Let's dispel self-doubt with action. You've got this!
I know you want, but I really don't want to do it, i am just feeling sad and unmotivated to train or to do anything kind of exercise.
I understand emotions can be challenging, yet physical activity often alleviates them. Let's channel this energy into something transformative. One step at a time, we'll ignite your spark again.
I don't want to train, but I feel like training could be beneficial for me, even though my motivation is very low, maybe we can train next time, but today I don't want to.

Your instincts are correct about the long-term benefits, but today's about meeting you where you are. Low motivation doesn't erase gains; baby steps still move us forward. Let's try one round, just for us.
